metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10929 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: The grub_memmove function in shlr/grub/kern/misc.c in radare2 1.5.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted binary file, possibly related to a read overflow in the grub_disk_read_small_real function in kern/disk.c in GNU GRUB 2.02.

notes.Note: sbeattie> does this affect upstream grub as well from a security perspective?

criterions.comment: radare2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
